hypotheses.title: Identify High Entropy File Creation by Unusual Processes
hypotheses.action: Hunt for file creations with high entropy filenames by processes not seen before in the last 1h

sigma.yaml:
title: High Entropy Filename Creation
logsource:
  product: windows
  category: file_creation
  service: sysmon
detection:
    selection:
      EventID: 11
      TargetFilename|base64entropy: '>=7.5'
    condition: selection

splunk.spl: index=oswinlogs EventCode=11 | eval entropy=base64entropy(TargetFilename) | where entropy>=7.5 | stats count by ProcessName, TargetFilename, _time | where count>=1

methodologies_enriched.name: PowerShell
methodologies_enriched.description: Adversaries may abuse PowerShell commands and scripts for execution. PowerShell is a powerful interactive command-line interface and scripting environment included in the Windows operating system.(Cit

hypotheses.title: Detect High Entropy Files Written by Network Services
hypotheses.action: Search for files with high entropy written by processes running as network service accounts in the last 1h

sigma.yaml:
title: Network Service High Entropy File Write
logsource:
  product: windows
  service: sysmon
  category: file_creation
detection:
    selection:
      EventID: 11
      TargetFilename|base64entropy: '>=7.5'
      User|contains: 'NETWORK SERVICE'
    condition: selection

splunk.spl: index=oswinlogs EventCode=11 User="*NETWORK SERVICE*" | eval entropy=base64entropy(TargetFilename) | where entropy>=7.5 | stats count by User, TargetFilename, _time | where count>=1

methodologies_enriched.name: SMB/Windows Admin Shares
methodologies_enriched.description: Adversaries may use [Valid Accounts](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1078) to interact with a remote network share using Server Message Block (SMB). The adversary may then perform actions as the

hypotheses.title: Identify High Entropy Files Accessed by Critical Processes
hypotheses.action: Hunt for high entropy files accessed by critical processes like lsass.exe in the last 1h

sigma.yaml:
title: Critical Process High Entropy File Access
logsource:
  product: windows
  service: sysmon
  category: file_access
detection:
    selection:
      EventID: 10
      TargetFilename|base64entropy: '>=7.5'
      ProcessName|contains: 'lsass.exe'
    condition: selection

splunk.spl: index=oswinlogs EventCode=10 ProcessName="lsass.exe" | eval entropy=base64entropy(TargetFilename) | where entropy>=7.5 | stats count by ProcessName, TargetFilename, _time | where count>=1
